Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O'Connor announced she is battling the beginning stages of dementia likely caused by Alzheimer's in a letter released to the public today the eighty eight year old O'Connor said she received your diagnosis some time ago but the progression of your condition
As led her to pull back on her public life she wrote that quote while the final chapter of my life with dementia will be trying nothing has diminished my gratitude and deeper appreciation for the countless blessings in my life
O'Connor was unanimously confirmed for the nation's highest court at the age of fifty one before her nomination by then president Ronald Reagan O'Connor served as an Arizona State court judge and with the first woman to lead the Arizona State Senate she retired from the Supreme Court in two thousand five
